page.title: 02FARMS AROUND LADDINGFORD
page.content: {FOXDEN FARM.}THERE ARE "HOPPERS" HUTS REMAINING NEXT TO THE TROUT POND ALTHOUGH THE HOPS ARE GONE. A TROUT FARM IS IN THEIR PLACE AND IT COSTS Â£10.00 TO FISH.ONE IS ALLOWED TO TAKE HOME 4 FISH.THE "HOPPERS" HUTS ARE USED FOR SHELTERS FOR FISHERMEN. BRAMLEY COOKING APPLES, WHICH ARE SOLD TO A MANUFACTURER OF BABY FOODS, ARE ALSO GROWN AT THIS FARM.THERE IS ALSO GRAIN, WHICH IS ROLLED IN THE FARM MILL AND USED FOR ANIMAL FEED. {EAST PIKEFISH FARM.}THIS FARM GROWS POTATOES,WHEAT AND OILSEED RAPE. THERE ARE 35 ACRES OF POTATOES WHICH ARE PLANTED IN LATE MARCH OR EARLY APRIL. THE POTATOES ARE LIFTED AT THE END OF JULY AND LORRIES COME TO THE FIELD TO PICK THEM UP.THIS IS ONE OF THE FEW FARMS THAT BREED CATTLE FOR BEEF IN THIS AREA.
